module.p:
[bi] bracaist ullamh a breakfast [is] ready –
Dh’éirich Màiri agus Calum tràth anns a’ mhadainn an diugh, oir bha iad ri dhol do’n sgoil. [...] Dh’éirich athair na cloinne agus màthair na cloinne aig sia uairean sa’ mhadainn. [...] Bha am bracaist ullamh aig cóig mionaidean gu ochd, agus shuidh iad uile aig a’ bhòrd aig ochd uairean.
Mary and Malcolm rose early in the morning today, for they had to go to the school. [...] The children’s father and mother rose at six o’ clock in the morning. [...] Their breakfast was ready at five minutes to eight, and they all sat down at the table at eight o’clock. td. 183

bracaist aig bòrd a breakfast at a table –
Dh’éirich Màiri agus Calum tràth anns a’ mhadainn an diugh, oir bha iad ri dhol do’n sgoil. [...] Dh’éirich athair na cloinne agus màthair na cloinne aig sia uairean sa’ mhadainn. [...] Bha am bracaist ullamh aig cóig mionaidean gu ochd, agus shuidh iad uile aig a’ bhòrd aig ochd uairean.
Mary and Malcolm rose early in the morning today, for they had to go to the school. [...] The children’s father and mother rose at six o’ clock in the morning. [...] Their breakfast was ready at five minutes to eight, and they all sat down at the table at eight o’clock. td. 183

thig ... gu bracaist ... comes for breakfast –
Dh’éirich Màiri agus Calum tràth anns a’ mhadainn an diugh, oir bha iad ri dhol do’n sgoil. Dh’éirich Màiri aig deich mionaidean an déidh seachd, ach cha do dh’éirich Calum gus an robh e fichead mionaid gu ochd. Ged a bha Calum fada gun éiridh, cha tug e ach cairteal na h-uarach air faighinn deiseil, agus thàinig e a nuas an staidhre gu a bhracaist aig cóig mionaidean gu ochd.
Mary and Malcolm rose early in the morning today, for they had to go to the school. Mary rose at ten minutes past seven, but Malcolm didn’t rise until it was twenty minutes to eight. Although Calum was late in rising, he only took a quarter of an hour to get ready, and he came downstairs to his breakfast at five minutes to eight. td. 182-3
